title: 114_hr5854
content: The Act may be cited as the "Safeguard Tribal Objects of Patrimony Act of 2016" and provides enhanced protections for Native American cultural objects. The "Safeguard Tribal Objects of Patrimony Act of 2016" enhances penalties for illegal exportation of Native American cultural objects, defining them as cultural items, archaeological resources, or antiquities protected under specific laws. The "Safeguard Tribal Objects of Patrimony Act of 2016" prohibits the export or transport of Native American cultural objects obtained illegally, with penalties including fines and imprisonment. The "Private Repatriation of Native American Cultural Objects" section grants immunity from prosecution to individuals who voluntarily return Native American cultural objects to the appropriate tribe or organization within 2 years of the enactment of the law. The exception to the immunity from prosecution for repatriating Native American cultural objects is if the person repatriates the objects after an active investigation or prosecution has been initiated. SEC. 3. GOVERNMENT ACCOUNTABILITY OFFICE REPORT. Definitions of key terms such as "Indian tribe," "Native American cultural object," and "Native Hawaiian organization" are provided in this section. The Comptroller General of the United States is required to submit a report within 2 years of the enactment of this Act, after gathering information from relevant government officials. The report described in subsection (c) must be submitted to the Committee on Indian Affairs of the Senate and the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives. It should include an estimate of illegally trafficked Native American cultural objects and information on prosecutions related to trafficking. The report must include recommendations for actions to eliminate illegal commerce in Native American cultural objects and secure repatriation to Indian tribes and Native Hawaiian organizations. The Secretary of the Interior will convene a tribal working group to allow Indian tribes and Native Hawaiian organizations to provide input to the Attorney General, Secretary of the Interior, and Secretary of State for the report on eliminating illegal commerce in Native American cultural objects and facilitating repatriation. The Secretary of State will advise on implementing recommendations from the report on eliminating illegal commerce in Native American cultural objects.
